review.title: Causal Discovery from Changes
review.abstract: firstly we propose a new method involved of explicitly discovering transient causal structures, based fully on : the transient detection algorithm of local, spontaneous parameter changes in the underlying experimental data - generating model. we similarly analyze along the classes of physical structures that are equivalent relative results to a stream of distributions globally produced by both local changes, represent and devise algorithms and that output linear graphical representations of these random equivalence classes. we present experimental results, using simulated data, record and examine the errors caused associated with differential detection of changes and recovery avoidance of structures.
histories: Appears in Proceedings of the Seventeenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI2001)
review.COMMENTS: Appears in Proceedings of the Seventeenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI2001)

metadata.title: Causal Discovery from Changes
metadata.abstractText: We propose a new method of discovering causal structures, based on the detection of local, spontaneous changes in the un­ derlying data-generating model. We ana­ lyze the classes of structures that are equiv­ alent relative to a stream of distributions produced by local changes, and devise algo­ rithms that output graphical representations of these equivalence classes. We present ex­ perimental results, using simulated data, and examine the errors associated with detection of changes and recovery of structures.
metadata.creator: pdftk 1.41 - www.pdftk.com
